text: Only think what an establishment it would be for the happiness of both, can not be too little said on the subject.

passages.fragment: Only think what an establishment it would be for
passages.full_quote: <used>Only think what an establishment it would be for</used> one of them

passages.fragment: it would be for the happiness of both
passages.full_quote: She respected, she esteemed, she was grateful to him, she felt a real interest in his welfare; and she only wanted to know how far she wished that welfare to depend upon herself, and how far <used>it would be for the happiness of both</used> that she should employ the power, which her fancy told her she still possessed, of bringing on her the renewal of his addresses

passages.fragment: for the happiness of both , can not be too
passages.full_quote: I write without any intention of paining you, or humbling myself, by dwelling on wishes which, <used>for the happiness of both, can not be too</used> soon forgotten; and the effort which the formation and the perusal of this letter must occasion, should have been spared, had not my character required it to be written and read

passages.fragment: can not be too little said on the subject .
passages.full_quote: "No really," replied Elizabeth; "I think there <used>can not be too little said on the subject</used>."
